newsitem.title: INDIA: Indian silver rebounds, gold continues to climb.
newsitem.headline: Indian silver rebounds, gold continues to climb.

text.p: Silver prices bounced back from the reduced level in early trade on the bullion market on Tuesday, dealers said.
Silver was down by 10 rupees per kg on Saturday and by 100 rupees last week.
"Renewed industrial buying as well as restricted arrivals dragged prices upward while speculative demand remained at low ebb despite recovery in the world market," one dealer said.
Gold on the other hand lifted further on the back of seasonal buying and shortage of ready stock. Gold was up by 25 rupees per 10 gramme last week.
Prices of gold biscuits (116.50 gramme) were steady at 60,300 rupees per piece. They were up by 300 rupees during last week.
